div.p: SITUATION OR THING which CAUSES something TO HAPPEN OR to be TRUE.
SITUATION OR THING which CAUSES something TO HAPPEN OR to BE TRUE.

1. The general word primarily for something further back in time causing something later in time, but also applied to logical grounds of any kind is gù 故, and the image is that of a solid background against which something is happening. Both subjective reasons and objective causes are referred to by this word.
2. Yīn 因 is what an animate or inanimate agent bases himself on in order to develop or act, and the image is that of leaning on it.

3. Yóu 由 and zì 自 are only occasionally nominalised and metaphorically construe the ground as something from which the consequence "flows", and the image is that of a source from which an action or a process flows.

4. Yǐ 以 is only occasionally nominalised and construes the grounds as something used by the consequence in order for it to be established, and the image is of the use a subject makes, in the course of some action, of something else.
5. Yuán 緣 is construed as grounds one uses as a guideline, and yuán 緣 always indicates grounds used by a person, and the image is of a guideline one follows in action.
6. Jī 機 is an objective cause construed metaphorically as a triggering mechanism for what is caused, and the image is of a mechanism triggering an event or an action.
來頭 refers to a subjective motive behind words or action.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

entry.def: Yǐ 以 is only occasionally nominalised and construes the grounds as something used by the consequence in order for it to be established, and the image is of the use a subject makes, in the course of some action, of something else.

sense.def: e.g. 必有以也 "there must be a reason": reason, grounds
basic causes
by one's choice of action bring about N1 for N2

entry.def: Yīn 因 is what an animate or inanimate agent bases himself on in order to develop or act, and the image is that of leaning on it.

sense.def: cause
cause much Nab
be the initial cause of, originate
be the unwitting cause of; preside over unwittingly as the person responsible
the reason why, that through which =所以

entry.def: The general word primarily for something further back in time causing something later in time, but also applied to logical grounds of any kind is gù 故, and the image is that of a solid background against which something is happening. Both subjective reasons and objective causes are referred to by this word.

sense.def: reason; precedent, antecedent; what is behind something, background, cause; reasons behind; basic features SHUOWEN: 使為之也。
the reason for N; the efficient cause producing/having produced N
reason for N
reason for something
cause (pain etc) by one's actions

entry.def: Jī 機 is an objective cause construed metaphorically as a triggering mechanism for what is caused, and the image is of a mechanism triggering an event or an action.

sense.def: causal mechanism; crucial mechanism; underlying mechanism
reason
bring it about that S (cf HYDCD sub verbo no. 29: 使，致使)
cause (damage, harm etc)
be brought about; be ensured

entry.def: Yóu 由 and zì 自 are only occasionally nominalised and metaphorically construe the ground as something from which the consequence "flows", and the image is that of a source from which an action or a process flows.

sense.def: the wherefrom of things, the source of the existence of things
the cause from which something flows
caused by> by

entry.def: Yuán 緣 is construed as grounds one uses as a guideline, and yuán 緣 always indicates grounds used by a person, and the image is of a guideline one follows in action.

sense.def: concrete basis, something to go by, lead; reason; plausible reason; more generally: circumstancesin the BUDDH context secondary causes, conditions as opposed to primary causes yin1 因; skr. hetu

entry.def: Yóu 由 and zì 自 are only occasionally nominalised and metaphorically construe the ground as something from which the consequence "flows", and the image is that of a source from which an action or a process flows.

sense.def: reason, source (for insight). See SINCE
